section.title: Debug existing variables
section.para: You already know the <echo> action that will trace messages to the console or logger. The <traceVariables> action is specially designed to trace all currently valid test variables to the console. This was mainly used by us for debug reasons. The usage is quite simple:
section.programlisting:
<testcase name="createVariablesTest"> <variables> <variable name="myVariable" value="12345"/> <variable name="nextVariable" value="54321"/> </variables> <actions> <traceVariables> <variable name="myVariable"/> <variable name="nextVariable"/> </traceVariables>
<traceVariables/> </actions> </testcase>
section.para: Simply add the <traceVariables> action to your action chain and the current variables will be printed out to the console. You can specify a special set of variables to be printed out by using the <variable> child elements. Or you simply leave the set empty and print out all available variables.
